subject: Public Speaking
title: Thomas Paine: Common Sense
description: A quick, practical guide to Thomas Paine: Common Sense.

hook.text: Paine wrote for ordinary people, not elites. His language was accessible.

buildup.text: Common Sense sold 500,000 copies. It was the era's viral content.

discovery.text: He argued complex political philosophy in simple terms.

twist.text: Accessibility was revolutionary. Philosophy for everyone.

climax.text: Paine proved you don't need academic language to change minds.

punchline.text: Write for everyone. That's how you reach everyone.
